entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Satyvadi Raja Harishchandra Marnotar Sahay Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was launched in the year 2000 to provide financial assistance to scheduled caste families at the time of the death of a family member to cover funeral expenses, due to their poor economic conditions.

fields.schemeName: Manav Garima Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers financial assistance to Scheduled Caste individuals who wish to establish cottage industries for self-employment without requiring bank loans. Employment/tool kits are provided to those who seek self-employment opportunities.

fields.schemeName: Cattle Shed Subsidy Scheme under Scheduled Castes Sub Plan (SC Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Cattle Shed Subsidy Scheme under Scheduled Castes Sub Plan (SCSP)” is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Government of Gujarat. Under this scheme, the financial assistance is given to Scheduled Caste beneficiaries for construction of Cattle Shed for 2 animals.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Financial Assistance to the Press Reporters of Puducherry
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Grant of Financial Assistance to the Press Reporters of Puducherry" by the Department of Information & Publicity, Union Territory of Puducherry, aims to provide financial support amounting to ₹25,000/- to eligible press reporters who have served in registered Newspapers/Magazines.

fields.schemeName: Fodder Minikits under Schedule Castes Sub Plan (SC Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Fodder Minikits under Schedule Castes Sub Plan” is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Government of Gujarat to provide an improved variety of fodder seeds to Scheduled Castes beneficiaries for widespread publicity, demonstration, and adaptation by farmers.

fields.schemeName: Free Bus Pass for Media Persons
fields.briefDescription: "Free Bus Pass for Media Persons" scheme by the Dept of Information & Publicity, Puducherry, aims to provide a free bus pass facility to media persons working in Puducherry in Puducherry Road Transport Corporation buses (except town buses) to undertake journeys for their professional requirements.

fields.schemeName: Disable Marriage Scheme (Divyang Lagna Sahay)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to persons with disabilities when a person with a disability marries another person with a disability, as well as when a non-disabled person marries someone with a disability.

fields.schemeName: Rajiv Gandhi Krishak Sathi Sahayta Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Rajiv Gandhi Krishak Sathi Sahayta Yojana offers financial support to farmers, farmworkers, and market laborers who are accidentally injured or killed while working in agriculture or at agricultural markets.

fields.schemeName: Post Matric and Top Class Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme Post Matric and Top Class Scholarship for Madhya Pradesh is provide financial assistance to students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds to pursue higher education.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy Scheme On Establishment Of 25 R.I.R. Birds’ Unit For Scheduled Caste
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R. Birds’ unit for Scheduled Caste” was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat to provide employment, nutritious diet and to raise the income of Schedule Caste People of the society.

fields.schemeName: Child Benefit Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to the children of registered building & construction workers who are enrolled in classes ranging from Class I to higher education levels or professional courses.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Orthopedically Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Orthopedically Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide marriage assistance to a normal person.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Allowance to Severely Affected Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Maintenance Allowance to Severely Affected Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance allowance to the severely affected persons who cannot be rehabilitated by any other assistance.

fields.schemeName: Pilgrimage Rejuvenation and Spiritual Augmentation Drive (PRASHAD)
fields.briefDescription: Launched in 2014–2015, the scheme "Pilgrimage Rejuvenation and Spiritual Augmentation Drive (PRASAD)" is a Central Sector Scheme by the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India. The scheme focuses on developing and identifying pilgrimage sites across India to enrich the religious tourism experience.

fields.schemeName: Solar Energy Assistance Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, Solar Light/Lantern (LED/CFL) will be provided to registered building & construction workers. The beneficiary will receive the benefit only once in their entire lifetime, even if both spouses are registered under the Board.

fields.schemeName: Toolkit Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to the registered building & construction workers for the purchase of tool-kits. The assistance will be given only once throughout the lifetime.

fields.schemeName: Scheme For Subsidy On Interest For Establishment Of 1 To 20 Milch Animal Farm For Scheduled Caste
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Subsidy on Interest for Establishment of 1 to 20 Milch Animal Farm for Scheduled Caste” was started by the Dept. of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to women registered construction workers during the maternity period, subject to the conditions specified by the Board. This assistance will only be provided upon the birth of two children.

fields.schemeName: Matrimonial Incentives
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, if a Person with Disability (PwD) gets married to a non-disabled person, then the couple is provided a marriage incentive of up to ₹ 50,000. Only citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply for this scheme.

fields.schemeName: SVAMITVA Yojana (Survey of Villages and Mapping with Improvised Technology in Village Areas)
fields.briefDescription: SVAMITVA, a Central Sector scheme of Ministry of Panchayati Raj to provide ‘Record of Rights’ to village household owners with issuance of legal ownership cards (Property cards/Title deeds) to the property owners by mapping of land parcels using drone technology.

fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: "Medical Assistance for the Construction Workers" was launched by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Dept, Delhi. The registered workers are given medical assistance upto ₹ 10,000/- in case of being hospitalized for 5 or more days due to an accident or disease.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Miscarriage for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: "Financial Assistance for Miscarriage for the Construction Workers" by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Delhi, is a welfare scheme that provides an amount of ₹3,000/- as financial assistance in case of miscarriage.

fields.schemeName: Uniform Allowance to the Wards of Ex-Servicemen/Widows (Sainik Welfare)
fields.briefDescription: "Uniform Allowance to the Wards of Ex-Servicemen/Widows (Sainik Welfare)" is a Welfare Scheme by the Dept of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. The wards of the ESM / Widows of ESM studying in Government-recognized Institutions are provided allowances towards purchase of their uniform.

fields.schemeName: Grant for the Purchase of Work Related Tools for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: "Grant for the Purchase of Work Related Tools for the Construction Workers" by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Dept., Delhi, is a welfare scheme that provides an amount of ₹5,000/- as grant to the members of the Fund, for the purchase of work related tools.

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Funeral Assistance for the Construction Workers" by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Delhi, is a welfare scheme that provides funeral assistance of ₹10,000/- in case of death of a member to their nominees/dependents.

fields.schemeName: Yatra Pass in DTC non AC Buses for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Yatra Pass in DTC non AC Buses for the Construction Workers" by the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Delhi, is a welfare scheme that provides a pass of ₹ 2400/- per three months for non AC DTC bus to the registered workers for purchasing.

fields.schemeName: Award of Scholarship to the Children who are Recipients of National Child Award for Exceptional Achievements and Other National / International Merit Awards
fields.briefDescription: The objectives of this scheme are to recognize the talents of children who are recipients of the National Child Award for Exceptional Achievements and other National/International Merit Awards and to recognize the talents of children who are pursuing outstanding achievements in different fields.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Disability Pension for Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Kanyadaan Scheme (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the Board provides financial assistance of ₹51,000/- in the form of Kanyadaan to registered construction workers on the occasion of the marriage of their daughters. This assistance is available for up to three daughters of the worker.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Purchase of House (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, interest free loan is provided to registered construction workers, who have minimum five year’s regular membership, for purchase or construction of their houses. This facility is available once in lifetime.

fields.schemeName: Award of Scholarships to Outstanding NCC Cadets of the UT of Puducherry
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to recognize and support outstanding NCC cadets. The scheme offers scholarships to eligible candidates in various divisions: Senior Division Boys (Up to graduation), Senior Wing Girls, Junior Division Boys (Up to 12th Standard), and Junior Wing Girls.

fields.schemeName: Sewing Machine Scheme (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to encourage registered women construction workers and to enable them to mend their clothing at their homes. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to registered women construction workers to purchase a Sewing Machine.

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the “Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board” (HBOCWWB) provides financial assistance for funeral expenses to the nominee or legal heir of a registered worker in the event of their death.

fields.schemeName: Multimedia Training - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu, launched the "Multimedia Training Program" for people with locomotor and hearing impairments.

fields.schemeName: Fare for Visiting Home Town (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a free traveling facility to visit the hometown once in a year for a family not exceeding 5 members is provided to the registered construction workers who have a minimum of two year’s regular membership of the Board.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Death Assistance
fields.briefDescription: "West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Death Assistance" is a social welfare scheme by the West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Board, Labour Dept., Government of West Bengal, that provides an one time assistance to the nominee in case of natural death/accidental death of the migrant worker.

fields.schemeName: E-Rikshaw Sahayta Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "E-Rikshaw Sahayta Yojana" for unorganized worker in 20 December 2016.

fields.schemeName: Mukhya Mantri Mahila Nirman Shramik Sammaan Yojana (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, registered female workers, who have minimum one-year’s regular membership, are being provided financial assistance of ₹5100/- for the purchase of Saree, Suit, Slippers, Raincoat, Umbrella, Sanitary Napkin and Kitchen utensil etc.

fields.schemeName: Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises: Subsidy for Water Conservation/Environment Compliance (WCS)
fields.briefDescription: “Subsidy for Water Conservation/Environment Compliance” incentives  by the MSMEs Dept., Government of West Bengal, aims to provide reimbursement of expenditure incurred by it towards the cost of captive Effluent Water Treatment Plant for wastewater recycling and/ or other pollution control devices.

fields.schemeName: Disability (Due to Accident or Other Reason) Scheme- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in Haryana based on their percentage of disability, whether the disability occurs due to an accident or other reasons inside or outside the workplace.

fields.schemeName: Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises: Subsidy for Patent Registration (PRS)
fields.briefDescription: “Subsidy for Patent Registration (PRS)” incentives under “Banglashree for MSMEs” scheme implemented by the MSMEs Dept., Government of West Bengal, aims to provide reimbursement of expenditure incurred for obtaining Patent Registration.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Encouraging Worker's Children's Participation in Cultural Activities- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the children of the workers working in the industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for participating in cultural competitions so that the children of the workers can also become good artists.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Widow/Dependent in case of Death of a Worker- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- is given to the widow or dependent of the worker working in the industrial and commercial establishments of Haryana state in case of his death due to any reason.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Handloom and Khadi Weavers Financial Benefit Scheme 2024: Support for One Time Settlement (OTS) of NPA Accounts of PWCS
fields.briefDescription: “Support for One Time Settlement (OTS) of NPA Accounts of PWCS" is a sub-scheme under "West Bengal Handloom and Khadi Weavers Financial Benefit Scheme 2024” by the MSME and Textiles Dept, Government of West Bengal aims to make PWCS debt free by providing financial support for OTS of NPA accounts.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Handloom and Khadi Weavers Financial Benefit Scheme 2024: Assistance to Individual Handloom Weaver
fields.briefDescription: “Assistance to Individual Handloom Weaver" is a sub-scheme under "West Bengal Handloom and Khadi Weavers Financial Benefit Scheme 2024”, implemented by the MSME and Textiles Dept, Government of West Bengal aims to  provide one-time financial assistance to the individual Handloom weavers.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Death Benefit for Weavers & Artisans of West Bengal
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Death Benefit for Weavers & Artisans of West Bengal" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles, Government of West Bengal aims to provide financial assistance to the family of the deceased weaver /artisan.

fields.schemeName: Mukhya Mantri Sharmik Surksha Yojana- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- will be provided to the widows/dependents of workers employed in industrial and commercial institutions in Haryana, in the event of the worker's death while working at the workplace.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Delivery of a Child or the Miscarriage of Pregnancy or the Termination of Pregnancy
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance for Delivery of a Child or the Miscarriage of Pregnancy or the Termination of Pregnancy" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to give financial assistance for the delivery of a child, miscarriage, or termination of pregnancy

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles - Folk Artists
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles" scheme was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, the Tamil Nadu Folk Artiste's Welfare Board provides financial assistance for the purchase of spectacles to registered folk artists.

fields.schemeName: Education Assistance - Folk Artist
fields.briefDescription: The "Education Assistance - Folk Artist" scheme was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides financial assistance for the education of children of registered folk artistes.

fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme for the Journalists
fields.briefDescription: The "Pension Scheme for the Journalists" was launched by the Tamil Development, Religious Endowments, and Information Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to give a monthly pension to retired journalists.

fields.schemeName: "Outstanding SC/ST Entrepreneur" under “Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Industries - State Awards to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises”
fields.briefDescription: "Outstanding SC/ST Entrepreneur" under “Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Industries - State Awards to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises” is a scheme by the Industries and Commerce Dept, UT of Puducherry, formulated to award the best SC/ST entrepreneurs.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme: Waiver of Fees for Land Conversion and Mutation
fields.briefDescription: “Waiver of Fees for Land Conversion and Mutation” incentives under “West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme” scheme implemented by the Dept. of MSME&T, Government of West Bengal, aims to provide a waiver of fees for conversion and mutation of the land as approved in the project.

fields.schemeName: Incentives for Meritorious Children (Students) of Workers (10th and 12th Class) (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the scholarship (prize money) in the form of fixed deposit will be provided to meritorious children of construction workers who have achieved academic excellence in Class X/XII examination.

fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance/Wage Compensation during Illness (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, wage compensation or financial assistance is provided to registered workers if they are admitted to any government or empanelled private hospital for treatment for a minimum of 4 days and a maximum of 30 days.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Svadeshi Gau Samvardhan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhyamantri Svadeshi Gau Samvardhan Yojana" under the "Nand Baba Milk Mission" aims to enhance milk productivity and per capita milk availability in Uttar Pradesh by encouraging the purchase of indigenous improved breed cows from outside the state and employment opportunities in rural areas.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Artisans Financial Benefit Scheme: Facilitation Supports
fields.briefDescription: “Facilitation Supports” is a sub-scheme under "West Bengal Artisans Financial Benefit Scheme 2024”, implemented by the MSME and Textiles Dept, Government of West Bengal. It aims to provide various types of facilitation support to the artisans and Industrial Cooperative Societies.

fields.schemeName: Financial Support Scheme
fields.briefDescription: With a view to extend the benefits of equity and access to quality education to the economically weak students, the University has introduced a financial support scheme for such students which will include fee waiver of all components of fee paid by students (except examination fee & hostel fee).

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme: Incentive for Energy Efficiency
fields.briefDescription: “Incentive for Energy Efficiency” incentives under “West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme” scheme implemented by the Dept. of MSME&T, Government of West Bengal, aims to provide a reimbursement for the cost of energy and installations for energy conservation as per energy audit.

fields.schemeName: Incentive for Purchase of Electric Scooter for the Daughter of a Registered Construction Worker (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, an incentive of ₹50,000/- or the actual ex-showroom price of electric scooter, whichever is lower, will be provided by the Board through e-RUPI to the daughter of a registered construction worker to facilitate her mobility while pursuing higher education.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance (Kanyadaan) on the Occasion of Marriage of Daughter- Haryana Silicosis Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹51,000/- is provided to workers suffering from silicosis, as confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, for the marriage of up to three of their daughters.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
fields.schemeName: Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) Internship
fields.briefDescription: The SECI Internship Policy is designed to provide practical experience to students in the renewable energy sector. The program aims to give interns exposure to SECI's various divisions, helping them understand the renewable energy sector.

fields.schemeName: Rehabilitation Assistance- Haryana Silicosis Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, silicosis-affected workers confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board will receive a one-time assistance of ₹5,00,000. If the worker dies before receiving the assistance, the amount will be payable to the widow or widower if married, or to one of the living parents if unmarried.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Persons Suffering from Rare Diseases
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Persons Suffering from Rare Diseases” was launched by Social Justice & Empowerment Department, Govt. of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹3000/- per month will be provided to all persons of Haryana domicile, who are suffering from Rare Diseases.

fields.schemeName: Silicosis Rehabilitation Pension- Haryana Silicosis Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹4,000/- is given to the Silicosis-affected worker categorized as category (A, B, or C) according to the ILO Classification, until he/she remains alive.

fields.schemeName: Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide prizes of ₹10,000/- and 10 awards to the author in the field of novels, short stories, drama, poems & prose in Tamil.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Financial Assistance for Publication of Manuscripts/Research Journals
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme of Financial Assistance for Publication of Manuscripts/Research Journals" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department of Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for publishing manuscripts/research journals.

fields.schemeName: Tholkappiar Award
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Tholkappiar Award" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to writers and authors for outstanding research publications in Tamil literature.

fields.schemeName: Unemployment Allowance for the Educated Unemployed Youth Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was introduced on 01.11.1988 which provides monthly unemployment allowance to the educated unemployed youth registered with the Employment Exchanges in Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Old Age Homes - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The "Old Age Homes" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This scheme is to bring qualitative improvement in the living standards of old people of the state.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Establishment of Backyard Poultry Units
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to improve the socio-economic and nutritional status of the poor families, small farmers and landless agricultural labourers and other economically weaker section of the society.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Divyangjan Empowerment Scheme (Sambal)
fields.briefDescription: The State government of Bihar launched the "Chief Minister Divyangjan Empowerment Scheme (Sambal) " scheme with the aim of improving the lives of Disable persons. Financial assistance is provided by the government through these schemes.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities to Scheduled Castes by Establishing Livestock Units under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, an unemployed resident of Haryana belonging to the Scheduled Caste category can avail a subsidy for purchasing livestock. This subsidy will be provided after the establishment of the livestock units and can be availed as a loan by the beneficiary.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities to Scheduled Castes by Establishing Livestock Units
fields.briefDescription: This is a credit-linked scheme with a primary objective of providing self-employment opportunities to Schedule castes, the unemployed persons will be assisted by way of establishing Dairy units, Piggery units, and Sheep/Goat units.

fields.schemeName: National Scheme Of Incentive To Girls For Secondary Education
fields.briefDescription: The National Scheme of Incentive to Girls for Secondary Education promotes the girl child's enrolment of 14-18 years age group at secondary stage, who passes class 8th and subsequently drops out for various socio-economic reasons.

fields.schemeName: Education Loan for Persons with Disabilities- Haryana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, education loans of up to ₹50 lakhs are provided to persons with disabilities (OH/VH/HH/MR) for pursuing professional and technical education both in India and abroad.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Establishment of Hi-Tech and Mini Dairy Units
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, unemployed persons will be assisted by way of providing financial assistance in form of subsidy for establishing dairy units of 4, 10, 20 & 50 milch animals like buffaloes, indigenous cows (Hariana, Sahiwal, Belahi, Red Sindhi, Tharparkar and Gir breeds only) and crossbred cows.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Prakhand Parivahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Mukhyamantri Prakhand Parivahan Yojana" to provide transportation facilities connecting blocks & remote Panchayats with district headquarters. This scheme aims to encourage scheduled castes, scheduled tribes, backward classes entrepreneurship by providing financial support to purchase buses.

fields.schemeName: Small Business in Service/Trading Sector for Persons with Disabilities (Divyangjan Swavalamban Yojana)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers loans up to ₹50 lakhs for self-employment to disabled persons in sectors like Agriculture, Small Business/Artisan & Traditional Occupations, Transport & Service Sectors, etc. Eligible individuals can access loans with interest rates ranging from 5% to 9% per annum.

fields.schemeName: Term Loan Scheme- Credit Line 1 for Minority Community
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam. Under this scheme, loans of up to ₹20,00,000/- are provided at a concessional interest rate to individuals from minority communities to enhance their employability.

fields.schemeName: Mass Communication Internship Programme
fields.briefDescription: The Mass Communication Internship Programme by the Department of Water Resources, River Development, and Ganga Rejuvenation. The intern program will offer work culture and environment knowledge about the functioning of the Government and its departments in information, education, and communication.

fields.schemeName: Term Loan under NSKFDC- Haryana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, loans are provided to Safai Karamcharis & their dependents for any viable income-generating activities with a maximum cost of up to ₹15,00,000/- per beneficiary. The beneficiary should be between 18 & 55 years of age and should be either Safai Karamchari or his/her dependent.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Education Loan Scheme (NSFDC)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme implemented by the National Scheduled Castes Finance & Development Corporation, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. Under this Scheme, loan is provided for pursuing full-time Professional/Technical courses in recognized institutions as one time assistance.

fields.schemeName: Additional Pension to 100% Disabled Ex-Serviceman having Children
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides an additional pension to 100% disabled ex-servicemen who were members of the Armed Forces & have been released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work, provided the disability or incapacity is attributable to service.

fields.schemeName: Partial Disability Benefit for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Partial Disability Benefit for the Construction Workers" by the Sikkim BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, is a welfare scheme of the board that provides financial assistance is provided to the nominees/ dependents of a member, in case of his/her partial disability.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Blind Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹3,000/‐ per month shall be granted to those Permanent Blind Ex-servicemen who are bonafide resident of Haryana & are not in receipt of any kind of pension/financial assistance either from Haryana Govt. or any other Department of Govt. of India.

fields.schemeName: Additional Pension to Widow of Ex-Serviceman having No Child
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, an additional amount of ₹100/- per month, in addition to the pension amount, is provided to the widow of an ex-serviceman who dies while in service but not in any battle.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Orphan Children of Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹3,000/‐ per month shall be granted to those Orphan Children of Ex-Servicemen only who are bonafide resident of the Haryana State and are not in receipt of any kind of financial assistance from any Department of Haryana Government.

fields.schemeName: Kalyanamastu Pathakam Scheme - Andhra Pradesh
fields.briefDescription: The "Kalyanamastu Pathakam Scheme - Andhra Pradesh" aims to encourage girls to marry the boys living in Andhra Pradesh who are getting their livelihood through Vaidikam, a one-time financial assistance of ₹75,000/- will be granted. In order to encourage Vedic culture as well.

fields.schemeName: Garuda Scheme for Funeral Expense
fields.briefDescription: The "Garuda Scheme for Funeral Expenses" aims to provide financial assistance for funeral expenses of a deceased Brahmin in their family, where the family has no other means to meet the same. This scheme covers Andhra Pradesh all 13 districts, to meet the funeral expenses of the deceased Brahmi.

fields.schemeName: Jharkhand Krishi Rin Mafi Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide relief from the debt burden to short-term agricultural loan holders in the state. Under this scheme, outstanding loan amounts of up to ₹50,000/- in standard crop loan outstanding accounts as of 31st March 2020, will be waived.

fields.schemeName: Krishak Bakri Palan Yojna
fields.briefDescription: The Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh has introduced a scheme named "Krishak Bakri Palan Yojna" with the aim to increase income generation opportunities for economically weaker segments of the society as well as to increase meat production.

fields.schemeName: Bharati Scheme for Education - 6th Class to 10th Class
fields.briefDescription: "The Bharati Scheme for Education - 6th Class to 10th Class" encourages Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh to continue their education. Under this scheme, financial assistance for the academic year will be granted to eligible poor Brahmin student applicants.

fields.schemeName: Bharati Scheme for Education Professional Education Course - Chartered Accountancy Final
fields.briefDescription: The "Bharati Scheme for Education Professional Education Course - Chartered Accountancy Final" encourages Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh to continue their education. Under this scheme, financial assistance for the academic year will be granted to eligible poor Brahmin students.

fields.schemeName: Bharati Scheme for Master’s Degree Overseas
fields.briefDescription: The "Bharati Scheme for Master’s Degree Overseas" aims to provide financial assistance to Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh, who secured admission for any master's degree course overseas in reputed institutions for the year or students pursuing part of their course abroad.

fields.schemeName: Bharati Scheme for Education - Intermediate or Equivalent
fields.briefDescription: The "Bharati Scheme for Education - Intermediate or Equivalent (ITI, Polytechnic, D.Ed, TTC, D.Pharmacy, etc.)" encourages Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh to continue their education. Under this scheme, financial assistance for the academic year will be granted to eligible poor Brahmin student.

fields.schemeName: Swami Vivekananda Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme (Class 11th & 12th)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, scholarships are provided to students studying in Class 11 and Class 12 in government schools, whose annual family income is less than ₹1,00,000/- and who belong to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Grant to Orphan Daughter of Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹51,000 is provided for the marriage of each dependent orphan daughter of an ex-serviceman, for up to two daughters, who are at least 18 years old.

fields.schemeName: Nirman Shramik Pucca Ghar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Labour and ESI Department, Government of Odisha has introduced a scheme "Nirman Shramik Pucca Ghar Yojana (NSPGY)" to meet the housing needs of the building and other construction workers in rural areas, registered under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (OB&OCWWB).

fields.schemeName: Integrated Social Security Scheme: Pension for Women in Distress
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Social and Tribal Welfare Department, Administration of Union Territory of Ladakh. Under this scheme, a financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month is provided as a pension to destitute widows, divorced, or deserted women with no source of income.
